meanings.definition: (of a firearm) Self-loading, capable of firing continuously with each pull of the trigger until the ammunition is exhausted.
meanings.sent1: The soldier carried a semiautomatic rifle during the mission.
meanings.sent2: The police officer used a semiautomatic weapon to apprehend the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The detective's semiautomatic gun jammed at the worst possible moment.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a semiautomatic weapon, firing accusations one after another.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the semiautomatic gunfire echoed through the empty streets.

meanings.definition: (of a process or system) Operating partially automatically and partially manually.
meanings.sent1: The factory installed a new semiautomatic assembly line to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The semiautomatic gate allowed both automatic and manual entry to the building.
meanings.sent3: The chef's semiautomatic pasta maker made a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a semiautomatic system, sometimes on autopilot and sometimes with full control.
meanings.sent5: The semiautomatic sprinkler system turned on automatically when it sensed a fire.
